New Records: Sikandar Raza became the Player of the Match with 3/25 bowling figures. Brad Evans scored 19 runs for Zimbabwe in a single innings, while Mohammad Wasim took 4 wickets for Pakistan with an economy of 6.00. Zimbabwe won by 1 run, their first win in the 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi was run out in the last over, costing Pakistan the match. Pakistan's middle order struggled, with key players like Shan Masood and Shadab Khan falling cheaply. Zimbabwe's chase was nerve-wracking but ultimately successful with a narrow 1-run victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Zimbabwe elected to bat first after winning the toss. Pakistan had a strong batting line-up but struggled to convert their starts. Zimbabwe's bowlers, led by Sikandar Raza and Brad Evans, maintained pressure throughout the innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Zimbabwe's coach praised the team's resilience and said the win was a turning point in their campaign. Pakistan's players expressed frustration at the narrow loss and the missed opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Perth Stadium. It was the 1849th T20I match. Zimbabwe's victory moved them to the top of their group in the tournament. Pakistan's loss put them under pressure in the group stage.
Others: The match was a high-pressure encounter with dramatic moments, especially in the last over. The result had significant implications for both teams' tournament progress.
